arxiv.title: AgentBench: Evaluating LLMs as Autonomous Agents in Collaborative Settings
arxiv.summary: We introduce AgentBench, a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating large language models as autonomous agents in multi-step collaborative tasks. Our framework covers 8 distinct environments including code generation, web browsing, and data analysis workflows...

arxiv.title: Beyond Prompt Engineering: Designing Interaction Paradigms for Human-LLM Collaboration
arxiv.summary: Current approaches to human-LLM interaction are predominantly prompt-centric. We propose a taxonomy of interaction paradigms that goes beyond single-turn prompting to include iterative refinement, mixed-initiative dialogue, and collaborative reasoning patterns...

arxiv.title: Trustworthy Qualitative Analysis with LLM Assistance: A Mixed-Methods Framework
arxiv.summary: We present a mixed-methods framework for conducting qualitative data analysis with LLM assistance while maintaining methodological rigor. Our approach combines automated coding suggestions with researcher oversight mechanisms...

semantic_scholar.title: Human-AI Teaming: A Survey of Recent Advances in Collaborative Intelligence
semantic_scholar.summary: This survey covers recent developments in human-AI teaming, focusing on systems where humans and AI agents collaborate on complex tasks. We identify key design patterns and open challenges...

semantic_scholar.title: Agentic Workflows: How LLM Agents Transform Knowledge Work
semantic_scholar.summary: We study how LLM-powered agentic workflows are reshaping knowledge work in enterprise settings, with implications for human-AI collaboration design...

hackernews.title: OpenAI's new agent framework lets AI systems collaborate with humans on complex tasks
The case for human-in-the-loop AI agents in research workflows
